Replies.Reply: In order to show you how a big symphony orchestra is put together, Benjamin Britten has written a big piece of music, which is made up of smaller pieces that show you all the separate parts of the orchestra.
Onto the bird-house, where every kind of bird imaginable is whirling and wheeling around. This is a real acrobatic act for our gifted young flute player, Paula Robeson.
So you see, the composer Benjamin Britten has taken the whole orchestra apart. Now he puts it back together again in a fugue.
This is the island of New Penzance.
Excuse me! Excuse me! Excuse me, Captain Sharp?

As some of you know, I taught Sam for the cartography Accomplishment Patch. He's a smart boy, and he expressed a keen interest in the history of the island's indigenous peoples. In particular, I recall his fascination with the idea of retracing the original path of the old Chickchaw harvest migration.
What I'm getting at is this: I think I know where they're going.

This is the island of St. Jack Wood, extending far north from Land's End along the deep-water channel that leads to Broken Rock. A low flood-plain separates the beach from the town-ship above. A small but prosperous community.
The barometer reads twenty-seven inches and dropping. Strong winds, as you can see, already at twenty-two knots.
The time is now four thirty-five A.M.
meteorological event of the second half of the twentieth century.
It lingered through six high-tides and inundated the islands with punishing winds and extreme high waters.
On St. Jack Wood, powerful surges broke the arcade boardwalk and demolished the village bandstand and casino.
The coastal areas of New Penzance were battered and changed forever.
But harvest yields the following autumn far exceeded any previously recorded, and the quality of the crops was said to be extraordinary.
Skotak. What's all this lumber for?
Why's it up so high? If somebody falls --
Your socks are down. Your shirt-tails are untucked. Your trousers are not properly pressed. You are reported for uniform violation!
How many rockets you up to, Panagle?
Izod, go fetch another pint of gun-powder from the armory shed.
Reckless cycling. Second warning. Next time, I take away the keys.
Jiminy Cricket. He flew the coop.
Captain Sharp, this is Randall Ward over at Camp Ivanhoe. Over.

One of my boys seems to have stolen a dug-
No. He left me a letter of resignation.
Excuse me, sir. This is Scout Master Ward speaking. Are you implying Sam's an orphan?
Why the hell doesn't it say that in the register? Excuse my language.

You have your orders. Use the orienteering and path-finding skills you've been practicing all summer. Let's find our man and bring him safely back to camp. Remember: this isn't just a search party, it's a chance to do some first-
You know, we're, actually, kind of, in the middle of something, if you didn't notice. This is a crisis. Anybody else?
No, you're not. This is a non-violent rescue effort. Your instructions are to find him, not to hurt him. Under any circumstances. Do I make myself understood?
I'm going to change my answer, in fact.
Be leery out there. OK, let's get started. Where's Snoopy?
You're going to be OK. Thank goodness, she missed the artery. Bite on this.
Don't worry, Mr. Bishop. She'll be safe.
What do I do about this?
I'm sorry about this. I didn't know your situation. It's not on the register.
You don't want to be a Khaki Scout anymore?
Stow it, out there! I want to hear some Z's!
No bugle? No reveille? Lazy-eye, Gadge, Deluca, Izod? Where's my troop? Let's go!
Supply and Resources! Call it out!
Fall in! We're going to run for it, boys!
Take the commander off of me.
We're going back out. I need volunteers.
Of course, I am. Come on.
Walt and Laura Bishop. Their daughter's the missing girl.
He wants you to live with him!
Pigeon Scout! Let's get you a patch.
I heard he never had any family in the first place.
No, she's in the woods with Shakusky.
Didn't you ever think about what would happen next?
I heard he's going to reform school.
He's going to work on a shrimper, if I understand correctly.
I don't know. I think I skipped a stitch.
Well, where would you've built it?
He's got great marksmanship. He shot Deluca in both arms.

emotionally disturbed -- but he's also a disadvantaged orphan. How would you feel?
He's a fellow Khaki Scout, and he needs our help. Are we man enough to give that?
They were prepared to die for each other out there.
For starters? Three yards of chicken wire, some ripped-up newspapers, and a bucket of wheatpaste.
Listen to me. We're here for friendship.
Yes, thanks. This is an emergency rescue.
Fort Lebanon. My cousin Ben runs the Supply and Resources outpost for the Jubilee. He's a Falcon Scout, Legionnaire. Cousin Ben'll know what to do.
There's a broken gum-ball machine behind the snack tent.
Seventy-six dollars -- but it's mostly in nickels.
Can we loan them the nickels? I'm worried about their future.
The vehicle appears to be in good working order. I'm just checking if --
Shakusky. Are we allowed to use force on him?
I'll tell you one thing: if we find him, I'm not going to be the one who forgot to bring a weapon.
Well, it doesn't matter, anyway. You don't have that authority. We've been deputized. Now are you going to come along peacefully or not?
It's tempting, but I can't allow it.
We know him a lot better than you. He's emotionally disturbed because his family died. Nickleby, tie him up.
Because your girlfriend stabbed me in the back with lefty scissors.

Hello? This is Captain Sharp. Over.
Morning, Randy. What can I do for you?
I guess we better notify his folks. Over.
Hello, sir. This is Captain Sharp.

I'm confused by that statement. You can't invite him back?
Am I speaking to Sam's father?
Mr. Billingsley, I've got an escaped Khaki Scout. We're notifying you as a matter of protocol. You say you can't invite him back? You say he's an orphan?
I disagree, Counsellor. It'd take him three days, at least.
Be that as it may, will you let me know if you see anything unusual?

I don't know, but just for the record: ninety-five percent of all runaways return home within six hours. That doesn't do you any good right now. It's just a statistic -- but in all likelihood Suzy's probably hiding in the closet at her best friend's house playing Chinese Checkers at this very moment, as we speak.
I got to get this spot-light fixed.
Sam Shakusky. That's my escaped Khaki Scout. His family died.
Why aren't we worried about that, then?
Well, I didn't know. Or, anyway, I thought I was wrong. Did you hit him?

I'm deputizing the little guy, the skinny one, and the kid with the curly hair to come with me in the station wagon. Randy, you drop-in and head up-river with the rest of your troop, then split-up on foot. Becky, call Jed and tell him to circle over this end of the island and fly low.
Puncture wound. Lower lumbar. Make room for a stretcher in the cockpit!
The infirmary at Fort Lebanon. We'll be right behind you.
Warm up the motor. I'll be right back.
Walt, it's very clear: the two of them conspired in this together.
-- but I also blame myself and both of you. With all due respect: you can't let your children stab people.
Easy does it. Calm down, Laura.
The fastest way is by seaplane. Jed can bring you in with the mail.
What's going to happen to him?
Excuse me. Shock therapy? Why would that be necessary? He's not violent.
That was the girl! Who did that.
I agree with you. That's eloquent. I can't argue against anything you're saying -- but I don't have to, because you're twelve years old.
Look, let's face it, you're probably a much more intelligent person than I am.
What's the rush? You've got your whole life in front of yourself. Ahead of you, I mean.
What does that have to do with it? So are you.
I'm sorry for your loss. Anyway, that's what people say.
Well, I hope you can. I think you will.
I admire them, you know? There's a purity to it. I only feel bad because they both seem like such unhappy, lonely, miserable people -- but maybe that's romantic.
I don't see it that way.
Jed, re-route to St. Jack Wood. Tell Social Services the boy's been spotted at Fort Lebanon.
Becky, notify the Bishops: Suzy's there.
What do you want me to say, lady?
Somebody get Jed a cup of coffee.
That's the first I heard of it.
You can't do this. They'll eat him alive in there.
What's the name of the place again?

I won't let you do it!
Where you going? What are you doing? Come down!
Social Services? Do you read me? Over!
Counsellors? What's the legal perspective? Over!
We're coming down! Over and out.
Scout Master Ward confirms they've had no luck. They're going home for the --
I'm not sure. I think he went searching in the dark.

Becky, I have your person-to-person from Chesterfield.
I heard he ran away because his family died.

That's not true. He just felt her up.
You shouldn't be friends with him.

Cat food! I think it's a clue.
I tried to chop him, but he dodged my tomahawk.
Supposedly, they got to third base.
What's going to happen to them?
What kind of bird are you?
No, I said, "What kind of bird are you?"
I feel we should go halfway today and halfway tomorrow, since you're a less experienced hiker, and you're wearing Sunday-school shoes.
Well, if your throat gets parched, stick a pebble in your mouth and suck on it.
Sometimes I stick leaves under my hat. It cools your head down.
Here's a trick. Throw grass in the air, and you can see which direction the wind's blowing.
Unknown. I guess it doesn't really matter, as long as we cover our tracks.
Not bad. Anyway, they're good for survival.
I agree. Why do you say that?
You're right. We'll let him live. Maybe I've got a licorice whip.
How strong of a swimmer are you?
OK. Well, I'm not that strong of a swimmer, so I wear a life-preserver. I think it's a good policy to get in the habit, anyway.
Watch out for turtles. They'll bite you, if you put your fingers in their mouths.
I'm a Khaki Scout. It's what I'm trained for.
We can feed your cat the guts and eyeballs.
What else did you bring? We should make an inventory.
That's it? No mess-kit? No flashlight? No canteen? No waterproof matches? Didn't you get the packing list I sent you in my last letter?
These are all library books. In my school you're only allowed to check-out one at a time. Some of these are going to be overdue.
Dear Suzy, You have a superb voice. You were my favorite animal in the program, by far. Please, find enclosed --
Dear Suzy, I am sorry your brothers are so selfish. Maybe they will grow out of it. Sometimes people do things without knowing the reasons for --
Dear Suzy, I accidentally built a fire while I was sleep-walking. I have no memory of this, but my foster parents think I am lying. Unfortunately, it is --
Dear Suzy, I have been trying very hard to make friends, but I feel people do not like my personality. In fact, I can understand why they might --
Dear Suzy, I know your parents hurt your feelings, but they still love you. That is more important. If they --
Dear Suzy, Here is my plan.
Dear Suzy, Walk four hundred yards due north from your house to the dirt path which has not got any name on it. Turn right and follow to the end.
I will meet you in the meadow.
Rats! I should've put more pine needles on it. Let's go. We're almost there.
No, I'm not. Didn't you get my letter of resignation? I quit the Khaki Scouts.
Listen to some reason: I don't like you.
They got Snoopy through the neck.
No, he doesn't. He needs a morgue.
Suzy. Look at me. Snoopy's not going to make it.
They're after us. We got to move.
It's too late! He's already gone!
I'm sorry I had to do that, but you're panicking. The first rule in any emergency is you never --
Who's to say -- but he didn't deserve to die.
Let's change it. What should it be?
Why do you always use binoculars?
That sounds like poetry. Poems don't always have to rhyme, you know. They're just supposed to be creative.
What do you want to be? When you grow up.
Go on adventures, too. Not get stuck, too. I guess that sounds almost like I'm just repeating what you just said, but I couldn't think of anything as good as it.
It's possible I may wet the bed, by the way. Later, I mean.
I wish I didn't have to mention it, but just in case. I don't want to make you be offended.
Some people frown on these problems.
It's not an accomplishment. I inherited it from my mother. It's actually not meant for a male to wear -- but I don't give a damn.
I don't think so. We're getting to know each other better. I feel like I'm in a family now. Not like yours, but similar to one.
I love you, but you don't know what you're talking about.
I gave them too much aggravation.
I admit we knew we'd get in trouble. That part's true. We knew people would be worried, and we still ran away, anyway --
Maybe so. Anyway, you're a bachelor.
That's true. Did you love someone ever?
A drunk truck driver smashed into them.
It's worthless to me. There's no point.
Did you leave another note for Lionel?
Field Mate Sam Shakusky, Troop 55, resigned.
Thank you, sir. By the way, where's the chapel tent?
I want to bring my wife.

I don't know what to say.
She left her binoculars on a hook in the chapel tent.
We can't. It's her magic power!
You killed your dog, by the way.
Why do you consider me your enemy?
I'm saying before that. Six weeks ago.
How deep is it? I didn't bring my life jacket.
they capture us, and we never see each other again anymore -- thank you for marrying me. I'm glad I got to know you, Suzy.

I lost my temper at myself.

I don't know. I just think he can feel us.
Pretty good. I broke our school record for the back-stroke.
Very good. You know a lot about camping, don't you?
That's OK. He only eats cat food.
This is my record player. It works with batteries. Actually, it belongs to my little brother Lionel. I left him a note.
This is my favorite record album. My godmother gave it to me for my birthday.
These are my books. I like stories with magic powers in them. Either in kingdoms on earth or on foreign planets. Also, time-travel, if they make it realistic.
I also brought my lefty scissors because I'm left-handed, my toothbrush, some rubber bands, extra batteries, and my binoculars, as you know. I forgot my comb.
I thought that's what you're supposed to bring. I don't own a canteen.

I might turn some of them back in one day. I haven't decided yet. I know it's bad. I think I just took them to have a secret to keep. Anyway, for some reason, it makes me feel in a better mood sometimes.
Well, I can show you an example, if you want -- but it doesn't make me feel very good. I found this on top of our refrigerator.
You really know how to make friends.

His eyes downcast, his kingdom in ruins, Mynar pressed his heavy paw through the rippling surface of the cool shallows and down to its stone floor. "My people once were lead by a great and noble beast --

Dear Sam, Thank you very much. I got replaced as the raven because I yelled at Mrs. Lynn. After that I was only a blue jay, but --
Dear Sam, You are an excellent painter, especially trees and telephone poles. Is the girl in the water supposed to be me?
Dear Sam, I am in trouble again because I threw a rock through the window. My mother still has glass in her hair. Also --
Dear Sam, Now I am getting suspended because I got in a fight with Molly. She says I go berserk. Our principal is against me. Why do --
Dear Sam, I do think you should think of their faces every day, even if it makes you sad. It is too bad they did not leave you more pictures of themselves. Can you --
Dear Sam, My answer is yes.
Maybe you just don't know him.
He's losing blood. Hurry. Where do we go?
He's dying! We can't just leave him!
Don't ever do that again. No one's allowed to slap me.
I like it here, but I don't like the name.

It's pretty. Do the other one.
It helps me see things closer. Even if they're not very far away. I pretend it's my magic power.
I don't know. I want to go on adventures, I think. Not get stuck in one place. How about you?
Are your foster parents still mad at you?
I always wished I was an orphan. Most of my favorite characters are. I think your lives are more special.

I wish I knew what makes you tick.
I know what you do with that sad, dumb police man. You go to bed with him.

Not this time. He can't keep his trap shut. Besides, I'll probably never see him again.
"-- but I'm not going," said Barnaby Jack. "I'm running away tonight for good, and this time I won't get caught."
He leapt out the window and landed in the fresh-fallen snow.
Maybe he's right. It could be a mistake.
Being married. Sometimes it seems sad to me. It might be better to just go steady permanently.
We might have to swim for it.
I don't know, but if it's too shallow, we'll break our necks, anyway. Hang onto me.
I think you've still got lightning in you.
I don't know, but she borrowed my record player for ten days without asking.
You're a traitor to our family.

Hello, Captain Sharp. This is Social Services. I'm calling in reference to Sam Shakusky, Ward of the State. I understand he's in your custody.
What's his condition? Has he suffered any injury or trauma of any kind?
Very good. How do I get to you?
provide reasonable care and nourishment for the boy until that time?

Well, normally, we'd try to place him in another foster home, but that option is no longer available to us, in my opinion, with his case history -- which means he'll go to Juvenile Refuge.

Well, maybe she needs help, too -- but that's not our job. OK?

-- to Social Services. Nothing else is in your power.
That's it! I'm citing you for gross misconduct! You are hereby summoned to appear before the board of --

Is this acceptable to you, Mr. Shakusky?

I want the details. Where's the scout she knifed?
I don't care how they do it where you come from. You want pop? You want candy?
